name: src/core/Config.js
src/core/EventTarget.js
EventTarget
description:
The EventTarget is a class that allows the use of custom events in it's instances. it is an implementation of the
Pub/Sub pattern.

It is generally not used directly but is inherited from in other classes

name: constructor
description: This MUST be called by sub-classes to instantiate the correct properties where events are stored.

name: on
description: Register an event handler for a type

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

params.name: handler
params.description: The function that will be invoked when the event is triggered. No signature is provided, it is up to the developer to determine what is passed to the listener at trigger time

params.name: context
params.description: The object the listener will called on. Defaults to `this` and can be changed if event delegation is needed.

name: once
description: Register an event handler that will trigger only once

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

params.name: handler
params.description: The function that will be invoked when the event is triggered. No signature is provided, it is up to the developer to determine what is passed to the listener at trigger time

params.name: context
params.description: The object the listener will called on. Defaults to `this` and can be changed if event delegation is needed.

name: off
description: Remove event handler, either of one type, or just one listener

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

params.name: handler
params.description: The event handler to be removed. If unspecififed, all handlers of the supplied type are removed.

name: listenTo
description: Utility to allow EventTargets to listen to other EventTarget's events easily

params.name: target
params.description: The instance of EventTarget to listen to events on

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

params.name: handler
params.description: The function that will be invoked when the event is triggered. No signature is provided, it is up to the developer to determine what is passed to the listener at trigger time

name: stopListening
description: Stop listening for events on another EventTarget

params.name: target
params.description: The instance of EventTarget to stop receiving events from.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of the event. A custom human readable string.

name: hasListeners
description: Determine if this object has events registered of a certain type

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} if the EventTarget has listeners for this type of event

params.name: type
params.description: Event type to check.

return.description: if the EventTarget has listeners for this type of event

name: trigger
description: Trigger an event on this object

params.name: type
params.description: The event type who's listeners will be triggered

params.name: eventParams
params.description: The parameters to be passed to the listening objects. Any number can be passed but it is recomended to only pass a single event object on which you may attach multiple properties.

name: src/display/BaseView.js
breakpointHandler
description: Single event handler from WindowManager breakpoint event. Handles calling of breakpointChanged on each instance if applicable

name: BaseView
description:
BaseView is the base class for organizing the DOM.
It is inspired by Backbone.js in certain regards, but is more ES6 and responsive friendly.
 *

name: breakpointChanged
description: Function is called when breakpoint is changed

name: addDomEvent
description: Bind a DOMEvent to the view, optionally filtered on the selector.

params.name: type
params.description: {String} Event typoe

params.name: listener
params.description: {Function} Event listener function that will be scoped to this view

params.name: selector
params.description: {String|Element} [this.el] if selector is a String, the string will be used to test matching using delegated events to `this.el`. If it's an Element then bind event directly to that element

name: removeDomEvent
description: Remove DOM event from the element

params.name: type
params.description: {String}

params.name: target
params.description: {DOMElement}

name: remove
description: Remove  DOM event listeners and remove the View element from the DOM.

name: destroy
description:
Removes DOM Element and DOM events. Unbinds other Events.
Call this to clean up the view before dereferencing it.

name: resize
description: Dummy function to implement resizing

name: minWidth
description:
Test to see if the viewport is currently at a certain breakpoint

Proxies WindowManager.minWidth

params.name: breakpoint
params.description: {Number|String|Object} a breakpoint name, object or numerical value. See WindowManager.minWidth for more info

name: src/display/ContainerView.js
ContainerView
description:
A view that can contain others.
Automatically call resize/breakpoints on children and destroy them on destroy

name: _addSubView
description: TODO rename to registerSubView

name: _removeSubView
description: TODO rename to unregisterSubView

name: src/display/Popin.js
src/display/PopinManager.js
displayPopin
description: Get Popin's DOM to display in popin-container

params.name: popinView
params.description: instance of Popin class

name: closePopin
description: Remove Popin from popin-container and hide that

params.name: cleanDom
params.description: use to know is method can remove DOM or not

name: src/display/SplitText.js
reset
description: Remove elements generated by text splitting process and reinject original contents

name: _renderString
description: Return the composed HTML of split text

params.name: content
params.description: {String} single char to create an element for

name: _createWord
description: Returns a span containing multiple characters

unknown.tagValue: {DOMElement} an element containing multiple char elements

params.name: charArray
params.description: {Array} Array of characters

return.description: an element containing multiple char elements

name: _parseNodeContent
description: Loop over element returning an array of elements and words. Each word is an array of chars.

name: src/display/StepPopin.js
src/display/dom/empty.js
empty
description: Simple function to empty an element

name: src/display/dom/index.js
index
description: Get index of an searchCriteria in a collection of nodes or a parent searchCriteria

name: src/display/dom/removeClasses.js
removeClasses
description: Remove multiple classes from an Element. Support removing classes with wildcards

params.name: element
params.description: DOM element to remove classes from

params.name: patterns
params.description: one or more class patterns. Patterns may be regular class names but can also contain `*` wildcards

name: src/display/dom/stringToElement.js
stringToElement
description: Turns a string representing one or more DOM elements into usable objects.

unknown.tagValue:
{Element|DocumentFragment} The DOM representation of the string. If multiple root tags are present in the
    string, it will return a DocumentFragment

return.description:
The DOM representation of the string. If multiple root tags are present in the
    string, it will return a DocumentFragment

_handleLoadComplete
description: Handle end of loading. including changing loader status and firing events

name: parseResponseBody
description: Helper to return a more usable object from the preloader. Simple detection based on file extension

params.name: url
params.description: the loaded file's URL

params.name: body
params.description: th loaded file's content

params.name: forceType
params.description: sometimes we need to force parsing of a certain type regardless of it's file name

name: LoaderQueue

PreloaderQueue

Simple Event & Promise based queue mechanism for loading multiple preloaders

name: src/utils/WindowManager.js
minWidth
description: Determine if the viewport is of a a minimum width

params.name: breakpoint.
params.description: If of type object, assumes to be a named breakpoint object with a value propert, if a string, a named breakpoint's name, if a number the breakpoint's value. A number maybe used to arbitrarily check window width

name: _detectBreakpoint
description: Called on window resize events to detect which breakpoint we're on
